Plot P-value Distribution Colored by Aggregated T_obs

Source: R/plot_pvalue_distribution.R
plot_pvalue_distribution.Rd

Visualizes empirical p-value distributions for selected features using a diverging color scale. The fill color represents the aggregated T-statistic (`T_obs`) per feature, using a user-defined aggregation function (e.g., mean, median).

Usage

plot_pvalue_distribution(
  x,
  features = NULL,
  aggregation_fun = mean,
  title = NULL,
  point_size = 0.5
)

Arguments

x

A data frame containing at least the columns feature, p_value, and T_obs.

features

Character vector of feature names to include in the plot. If NULL, the first 9 unique features in x are used.

aggregation_fun

A function used to summarize T_obs values per feature. Default is mean. Other options include median, or any custom summary function.

title

Optional character string to set the plot title.

point_size

Numeric. Controls base font size (currently not actively used, retained for consistency).

Value

A ggplot2 object with facetted histograms showing p-value distributions, colored by the aggregated T-statistic value per feature.

Examples

# Basic usage with default mean aggregation
plot_pvalue_distribution(combined_results)
#> Error: object 'combined_results' not found

# Using median aggregation
plot_pvalue_distribution(combined_results, aggregation_fun = median)
#> Error: object 'combined_results' not found
